properties.doc:
Core Context Properties =======================
This is the list of the core contextual properties of the Maemo platform.
This document is maintained as part of the +contextkit+ package. Please report change requests as bugs against the +contextkit+ package.
*NOTE:* Most of these properties are unstable and their definition will change for some time still. Only the ones explicitly marked as stable should be used for now.

node.name: Screen
node.doc:
Display screens ---------------
These properties talk about the display screens of the device.

key.name: TopEdge
key.doc: The edge of the main display screen where the user expects the top-most UI elements to be. Possible values are the strings "top", "bottom", "left", and "right", which refer to the edges of the screen in its normal orientation as defined by the graphics hardware. _(stable)_

key.name: IsCovered
key.doc: Whether or not the main display screen is covered and can thus not be seen by the user. This might mean that the device is laying face down on a table, or that its lid is closed if it has one. _(stable)_

node.name: Location
node.doc:
Location --------
Best effort location information. If any of the keys are not appliciable to the current location, they will be unavailable.

key.name: Coordinates
key.doc: The coordinates of the current position as a list of two or three doubles. The first two elemets are latitude and longitude, respectivly, in degrees. The third element, when present, is the altitude in meter.

key.name: Street
key.doc: The street nearest the location of the device, as a localized string.

key.name: PostalCode
key.doc: The postcode of the location of the device, as a localized string.

key.name: Area
key.doc: The name of the local area where the device is, for example a neighborhood or campus, as a localized string.

key.name: Locality
key.doc: The name of the village, town or city where the device is, as a localized string.

key.name: Region
key.doc: The administrative region which contains the location of the device, as a localized string.

key.name: Country
key.doc: The country which contains the location of the device, as a localized string.

key.name: CountryCode
key.doc: The ISO 3166 two letter country code of the country which contains the location of the device.

key.name: Timezone
key.doc: TBD

key.name: TimezoneOffset
key.doc: TBD

key.name: Continent
key.doc: The name of the current continent, as a localized string.

key.name: Planet
key.doc: The name of the current planet (or dwarf planet), as a localized string.

key.name: PointOfInterest
key.doc: The URI of the current point of interest, if any. (The URI points to a Nepomuk object inside the Content Framework.)

key.name: NearbyContacts
key.doc: A list of URIs for contacts that are physically nearby. (The URIs point to Nepomuk objects.)

node.name: Battery
node.doc:
Battery -------
Information about the batteries of the device.

key.name: ChargePercentage
key.doc: The average charge level of the currently connected batteries. Expressed as percentage of the maximum charge level.

key.name: OnBattery
key.doc: Whether or not the device is currently running on battery power, i.e., whether at least one of its batteries is currently discharging.

key.name: LowBattery
key.doc: Whether or not the device is currently running on low battery power. True if OnBattery is true and the charge levels of all batteries are below 10%.

key.name: IsCharging
key.doc: Whether or not the device is currently charging at least one of its batteries.

key.name: TimeUntilLow
key.doc: Estimates the time that the device can run on battery before the property OnLowBattery becomes true. In seconds.

key.name: TimeUntilFull
key.doc: Estimates the needed charging time of the device. In seconds.

node.name: Internet
node.doc:
Internet connectivity ---------------------
Information about the connection of the devide to the Internet.

key.name: NetworkType
key.doc: The type of the current connection to the Internet, such as GPRS, WLAN, etc. The possible value are TBD.

key.name: NetworkName
key.doc: The name of the current access point.

key.name: NetworkState
key.doc: The state of the Internet connection, values TBD but will include things like "connected, "disconnected", "connecting".

key.name: NetworkID
key.doc: The unique id of the network.

key.name: ServiceName
key.doc: (Unclear)

key.name: SignalStrength
key.doc: The signal strength of the current connection to the Internet. This will be 100% percent for wired connections, usually.

key.name: IsCheap
key.doc: Whether or not traffic to/from the Internet is billed per data volume (property is false) or per time (property is true).

key.name: TrafficOut
key.doc: A rough indication of the current traffic rate to the Internet, in percent of the maximum possible rate.

key.name: TrafficIn
key.doc: A rough indication of the current traffic rate from the Internet, in percent of the maximum possible rate.

node.name: Bluetooth
node.doc:
Bluetooth ---------
Information about Bluetooth related things.

key.name: Enabled
key.doc: A boolean indicating whether or not the Bluetooth radio is enabled.

key.name: Visible
key.doc: A boolean indicating whether or not the device is visible to other Bluetooth devices when they search for others.

key.name: TrafficOut
key.doc: A rough indication of the current outgoing traffic rate over Bluetooth, in percent of the maximum possible rate.

key.name: TrafficIn
key.doc: A rough indication of the current incoming traffic rate over Bluetooth, in percent of the maximum possible rate.

key.name: SignalStrength
key.doc: The strength of the Bluetooth radio connection.

node.name: Environment
node.doc:
Environment -----------
Information about the environment the device is in.

key.name: IsDark
key.doc: Whether or not it is dark.

key.name: SunRise
key.doc: The time of sun rise.

key.name: SunSet
key.doc: The time of sun set.

key.name: Weather
key.doc: The current weather. See http://www.ominous-valve.com/wx_codes.txt for more information about codifying weather conditions. We should lift something from there, if just for extra geek points. + The value of the weather property is a dictionary with the following keys. All keys are optional and additional keys might be present. + - *Condition* + The current weather condition, as a localized, human readable string. Examples are "Cloudy", "Raining", etc. + - *ConditionCode* + The current weather condition, as a symbolic string. The set of symbols is to be defined, but it will be fixed and quite small so that you can provide an icon for each of them, etc. + - *Humidity* + The relative humidity in percent. + - *Temperature* + The temperature as a localized string. This string represents the temperature in the way preferred by the user. Most often this means either degrees Celsius or degrees Fahrenheit, but it could be some other unit entirely. + - *TemperatureK* + The temperature in Kelvin. + - *ApparentTemperature* + The felt temperature as a localized string, analogous to Temperature. + - *ApparentTemperatureK* + The felt temperature in Kelvin. + - *DewPoint* + The dew point as a localized string, analogous to Temperature. + - *DewPointK* + The dew point in Kelvin. + - *Pressure* + The atmospheric pressure in milli bar. + - *Precipitation* + The rain or snow fall in millimeter per square meter per hour (or some other more common unit). + - *Visibility* + The visibility in meter. + - *WindSpeed* + The wind speed in meters per second. + - *WindDirection* + The wind direction as a localized string. The direction is given in compass terms: North, South-West, etc. + - *WindDirectionD* + The wind direction in degrees. North is 0, east is 90, etc.

key.name: IsDark
key.doc: Whether or not it is especially dark.

key.name: IsBright
key.doc: Whether or not it is especially bright.

key.name: IsLoud
key.doc: Whether or not it is especially loud.

node.name: Use
node.doc:
Use ---
Information about the current usage context of the device.
Situations are a UI concept similar to Profiles that allows the user to have different customizations for his/her device and automatically/explcicitly switch between them. Typical Situations are "AtHome", "AtWork", "InMeeting" etc. Some of them are probably pre-defined, others can be defined by the user. Situations might form a hierarchy: InMeeting includes AtWork.
Not much is known about all this right now.

key.name: Situations
key.doc: The symbolic names of the currently active Situations. Note that more than one situation might be active at the same time.

key.name: Mode
key.doc:
The current main usage mode of the device, as one of the following choices:
editing:: The user is interacting closely with the device and is creating new content, such as when composing a email message or creating any other kind of document.
recording:: The user is taking pictures, or recording video or audio.
browsing:: The user is interacting closely with the device without creating new content, such as when browsing search results, or browsing through his/her music collection.
watching:: The user is watching a video, without closely interacting with the device.
listening:: The user is listening to audio, without closely interacting with the device.
reading:: The user is reading a document, such as when reading a article on the web or a e-book.
chatting:: The user is involved in a real-time, text-based dialog with external parties.
gaming:: The user is interacting closely with the device, for entertainment.
calling:: The user is involved in a real-time, audio- or video-based dialog with external parties.
active:: The user interacting closely with the device, for an activity that doesn't fit into any of the above categories.
idle:: The device is not being used.

key.name: ConnectedContacts
key.doc: A list of URIs for contacts that the user is currently engaged in conversations with. (The URIs point to Nepomuk objects.)

key.name: RecentDocuments
key.doc: A list of URIs for recently used documents, at most ten elements long. (The URIs point to Nepomuk objects.)

key.name: Keyboarding
key.doc: Whether or not the user is ready to use the keyboard. This property is true when a slideout keyboard has been slided out, for example, or when a transformer laptop with a tablet mode is in "laptop mode".

key.name: Phoning
key.doc: Whether or not the user is using the device as a telephone handset, holding it next to ear and mouth.

node.name: Events
node.doc:
Events ------
Information about current and upcoming calendar entries.

key.name: Current
key.doc: The currently active events, as a list of Nepomuk URIs. The list contains all events whose start time is earlier than or equal to the current time, and whose end time is later.

key.name: CurrentStart
key.doc: The earliest start time of the events in Events.Current.

key.name: CurrentEnd
key.doc: The latest end time of the events in Events.Current.

key.name: Next
key.doc: The upcoming events, as a list of Nepomuk URIs. The list contains those events whose start time is later than the current time and closest to now. If there are multiple events in the list, they all start at exactly the same time.

key.name: NextStart
key.doc: The earliest start time of the events in Events.Next.

key.name: NextEnd
key.doc: The latest end time of the events in Events.Next.
